revised_title: Investigation of the Constants of Explosion of Cordite and Modified Cordite
tldr: This study investigates the constants of explosion of cordite and modified cordite, focusing on the effects of non-explosive ingredients like mineral jelly and acetone. The research uses a bomb calorimeter to measure the heat released and the gases produced during the explosion. The results show that modified cordite has a lower heat of explosion, higher gas volume, and different gas composition compared to the original cordite. The presence of mineral jelly and acetone in both types of cordite is also examined, revealing their impact on the explosion constants.
